caption.p: Figure S1. (A) A flow chart of UC-MSC preparation for clinical use, including cell isolation, expansion, characterization, certification and safety assessment prior to transplantation. (B) Cell shapes at passages 1, 6 and 15. (C) Flow cytometry analysis of UC-MSCs showed high positive rates of CD105, CD73, CD90 and CD29, while CD45 and CD34 were negative. (D) Immunofluorescence of FABP, osteocalcin and aggrecan and immunohistochemical staining using Oil-red O, Alizarin Red and Alcian blue exhibited the presence of lipids, mineralized plaques and cartilaginous substrates derived from UC-MSCs, respectively. (TIF 4967Â kb)
